Name: Bohemian Mule
Ingredients: 7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Collins glass .
STRAIN into ice-filled glass whilst also pouring ginger beer.
Review: Long and refreshing whilst also packing a full shot of absinthe - perhaps the best spirit to hold its own when drowned with fiery ginger beer, a combo used to good effect in this mule with lime juice.
History: Created in 1990s by Giovanni Burdi, London, England. Moscow Mule cocktail history
Nutrition: One serving of Bohemian Mule contains 206 calories
